full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 773 Filed 08/10/22 Page 6 of 29 3123 LCRVMAXT "entice" means to attract, induce, or lure using hope or desire. Ms. Moe. MS. MOE: Yes, your Honor. Thank you. THE COURT: Mr. Everdell. MR. EVERDELL: That's fine, your Honor. Thank you. THE COURT: All right. Thank you. I will write that note and send it back. We'll mark -- I'm sorry, I forget what court exhibit we're on, but we'll mark this note as the next court exhibit once Ms. Williams reminds me where we are. All right. Thank you. Yes. MS. STERNHEIM: Judge, I just have a quick statement, and I'm asking the Court's assistance. You mentioned on Friday that -- I guess it was Wednesday that we're supposed to wear N95 masks in the courtroom -- or in the courthouse, I should say. THE COURT: Yes. MS. STERNHEIM: And it's my understanding that one has been provided for Ms. Maxwell, but she can only wear it in the courtroom. And I think that that is not a correct health standard. THE COURT: The rule actually is in the courthouse. MS. STERNHEIM: In the courthouse. SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00017310
